it.polimi.se2018.controller.network.server

Interface RMISession

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RMICommLayerTest.RMISessionTest, RMISessionImpl

    public interface RMISession
extends java.rmi.Remote
    The interface used by session objects
    Author:
    Francesco Franzini

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LoginResponsesEnum getLoginOutput()
      Returns a textual representation of the login result
      java.io.Serializable getObj()
      Pops an ingoing(directed to the Client) object.
      AbsReq getReq()
      Pops an ingoing(directed to the Client) request.
      boolean hasObj()
      Checks if there are unread objects
      boolean hasReq()
      Checks if there are unread requests
      boolean isTerminated()
      Checks if the server has terminated this session object
      boolean sendObj(java.io.Serializable obj)
      Pushes a serializable object to the server
      boolean sendReq(AbsReq obj)
      Pushes a request to the server

    • Method Detail

      • hasReq

        boolean hasReq()
        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Checks if there are unread requests
        Returns:
        true if there are unread requests
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getReq

        AbsReq getReq()
       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Pops an ingoing(directed to the Client) request. If none are available it blocks until one is pushed
        Returns:
        a request or null if errors occurred
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an I/O error occurs

      • sendReq

        boolean sendReq(AbsReq obj)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Pushes a request to the server
        Parameters:
        obj - the request to push
        Returns:
        true if no errors occurred
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an I/O error occurs

        java.io.Serializable getObj()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Pops an ingoing(directed to the Client) object. If none are available it blocks until one is pushed
        Returns:
        a serializable object or null if errors occurred
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an I/O error occurs

      • sendObj

        boolean sendObj(java.io.Serializable obj)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Pushes a serializable object to the server
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to push
        Returns:
        true if no errors occurred
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an I/O error occurs

      • isTerminated

        boolean isTerminated()
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Checks if the server has terminated this session object
        Returns:
        true if this session object is no longer valid
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an I/O error occurs
